identificationModule.officialTitle: Re-examination Study for General Drug Use to Assess the Safety and Efficacy Profile of JANUMET in Usual Practice

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This survey is conducted for preparing application materials for re-examination under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Laws and its Enforcement Regulation, its aim is to reconfirm the clinical usefulness of sitagliptin/metformin (JANUMET) through collecting the safety and efficacy information according to the Re-examination Regulation for New Drugs.

armGroups.label: All participants
armGroups.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

interventions.name: Sitagliptin/metformin
interventions.description: Sitagliptin/metformin 50/500 mg, 50/850 mg, or 50/1000 mg tablet administered twice daily with meals.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With Any Adverse Experience
primaryOutcomes.description: An adverse event (AE) is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function or chemistry of the body temporally associated with study drug administration whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in Hemoglobin HbA1c (A1C) at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.description: HbA1C is found when high blood levels of glucose combines with hemoglobin to form glycated hemoglobin. The average amount of glucose in blood over a prolonged periods of time can be determined by measuring a hemoglobin A1c level which is reported as a percentage (%). The change from baseline reflects the Week 12 A1C minus Week 0 A1C.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after an 8- to 10-hour fast). FPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus Week 0 FPG.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in 2-hour Post Prandial Glucose (2hr-PPG) at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood glucose was measured 2 hours after a meal (2hr-PPG). 2hr-PPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 2hr-PPG minus Week 0 2hr-PPG.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With an Overall Efficacy Evaluation by the Investigator of Improved, Stable, or Worse at Week 12
primaryOutcomes.description: Overall efficacy analysis was conducted on participants who have used study drug for more than 12 weeks and whose improvement of the disease has been assessed by Principal investigator. The investigator's global assessment of disease improvement was classified as either: "Improved", "Stable" and "Worse" in a Medical History/Physical Examination form.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in HbA1c at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 A1C minus Week 0 A1C.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in FPG at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after an 8- to 10-hour fast). FPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 FPG minus Week 0 FPG.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in 2hr-PPG at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood glucose was measured 2 hours after a meal (2hr-PPG). 2hr-PPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 2hr-PPG minus Week 0 2hr-PPG.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With an Overall Efficacy Evaluation by the Investigator of Improved, Stable, or Worse at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: Overall efficacy analysis was conducted on participants who have used study drug for more than 24 weeks and whose improvement of the disease has been assessed by Principal investigator. The investigator's global assessment of disease improvement was classified as either: "Improved", "Stable" and "Worse" in a Medical History/Physical Examination form.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Has type 2 diabetes mellitus
* Is treated with sitagliptin/metformin within local label for the first time

Exclusion Criteria:

* Has a contraindication to sitagliptin/metformin according to the local label
* Is treated with sitagliptin/metformin before contract and out of enrollment period
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin in usual practice

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: In this post-marketing surveillance study of sitagliptin/metformin (JANUMET®), participants in South Korea treated for \>= 24 weeks were evaluated for long-term safety and efficacy. During the re-examination study period (December 4, 2005 to September 20, 2013), case report forms (CRFs) were collected from 4,065 participants.

groups.title: All Participants Included in the Safety Evaluation
groups.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: Baseline characteristics were only reported for the Safety Population (4033) who qualified for the study and not for the 4065 participants from whom CRFs were collected.
